org.js4ms.net.ip
Interface IPMessage

All Superinterfaces:
Loggable
All Known Implementing Classes:
ICMPv6Message, IGMPGroupMessage, IGMPMessage, IGMPQueryMessage, IGMPv2LeaveMessage, IGMPv2QueryMessage, IGMPv2ReportMessage, IGMPv3QueryMessage, IGMPv3ReportMessage, IPAuthenticationHeader, IPEncapsulatingSecurityPayload, IPExtensionHeader, IPinIPHeader, IPPayload, IPv6DestinationOptionsHeader, IPv6FragmentHeader, IPv6HopByHopOptionsHeader, IPv6OptionsHeader, IPv6RoutingHeader, IPv6RoutingType0Header, MLDGroupMessage, MLDMessage, MLDQueryMessage, MLDv1DoneMessage, MLDv1QueryMessage, MLDv1ReportMessage, MLDv2QueryMessage, MLDv2ReportMessage, UdpPacket
public interface IPMessage
extends Loggable

Base interface for all IP protocol messages.

Author:
Gregory Bumgardner (gbumgard)

Nested Class Summary
static class IPMessage.Parser
          Base class for parsers that parse a family of IP messages.
static interface IPMessage.ParserType
          Base interface for individual IP message parsers.
 
Field Summary
static byte NO_NEXT_HEADER
          Protocol number used to indicate that no additional IP message headers follow the current header.
 
Method Summary
 int getHeaderLength()
          Returns the byte-length of the message header.
 IPMessage getNextMessage()
          Returns the IP message that follows this message, or null if no such message exists.

          Returns the protocol number value of the next IP message header.

          Returns the IP protocol number of the message.
 int getTotalLength()
          Returns the total byte-length of the message including the message header.

          Removes the next IP message that follows this message.

          Sets the IP message that will follow this message.

          Updates the checksum of a message contained in the byte buffer;

Field Detail

NO_NEXT_HEADER

static final byte NO_NEXT_HEADER
Protocol number used to indicate that no additional IP message headers follow the current header.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getProtocolNumber

byte getProtocolNumber()
Returns the IP protocol number of the message.

Returns:

setProtocolNumber

void setProtocolNumber(byte protocolNumber)
Sets the IP protocol number of the message. Most subclasses override this method to do nothing because the protocol number is defined by the message subclass.

Parameters:
protocolNumber -

getNextProtocolNumber

byte getNextProtocolNumber()
Returns the protocol number value of the next IP message header. If no IP message follows the current message, this method will return a value of NO_NEXT_HEADER. This function is primarily used to return the "Next Header" field in extension headers. See IPExtensionHeader.NextHeader.

Returns:

getNextMessage

IPMessage getNextMessage()
Returns the IP message that follows this message, or null if no such message exists.

Returns:

setNextMessage

void setNextMessage(IPMessage header)
Sets the IP message that will follow this message. This method is primarily intended for use in extension headers.

Parameters:
header -

removeNextMessage

void removeNextMessage()
Removes the next IP message that follows this message. This method is primarily intended for with extension headers.

getHeaderLength

int getHeaderLength()
Returns the byte-length of the message header. For fixed-size messages, this is often the same value as the returned from getTotalLength().

Returns:

getTotalLength

int getTotalLength()
Returns the total byte-length of the message including the message header.

Returns:

writeTo

void writeTo(ByteBuffer buffer)
Writes the message to a byte buffer and advances the current position of that buffer.

Parameters:
buffer - - the ByteBuffer into which the message will be written.

writeChecksum

void writeChecksum(ByteBuffer buffer,
                   byte[] sourceAddress,
                   byte[] destinationAddress)
Updates the checksum of a message contained in the byte buffer;

Parameters:
buffer - - a ByteBuffer containing the message.
sourceAddress - An IPv4 (4-byte) or IPv6 (16-byte) address. Size must match that of the destination address.
destinationAddress - An IPv4 (4-byte) or IPv6 (16-byte) address. Size must match that of the destination address.
